attributes.action: Ensure that Britain complies with Article 31 of the Convention on the Rights of the Child - The right for children to 'Play Out'
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Many parents feel unable or unwilling to let children go out to play. Instead children are often forced to resign themselves to a sedentary virtual existence on a computer. Article 31 of the Convention on the Rights of the Child states Parties recognize the right of the child to … engage in play and recreational activities appropriate to the age of the child …

Older children used to go ‘out to play.’ This is often now not possible. In Britain we should start to provide areas free from vehicles and stranger danger in order that they can fulfil this important stage in their development.
